SUBJECT: Sponsored ADS
DETAILS: Icici Bank Ltd has informed the Exchange that pursuant to notifications issued by the Government of India and the Reserve Bank of India, Foreign Investment Promotion Board by their letter dated February 22, 2005 and the equity shareholders of ICICI Bank(the "Bank") by way of special resolution dated January 28, 2005 by way of a postal ballot, have provided their approval to the bank to sponsor an ADS offering against equity shares to be divested by the equity shareholders. The bank is sponsoring an underwritten public offering up to 6% of the Bank's paid up equity share capital. The bank is providing all equity shareholders the opportunity to participate as a selling shareholder in the offering of ADSs on the terms and conditions contained in a separate invitation to Participate together with the accompanying  documents (the "invitation").This facility is being made available to all the equity shareholders of the company's on a pari passu basis. The bank is sending copies of invitation to all equity shareholders whose names appear on the register of members maintained with the company, and the register and index of beneficial owners maintained with the depository, in each case at the close of business on February 25,2005.Futher,the invitation is being sent to equity shareholders at their registered address in India, and if any equity shareholder does not have a registered address in India, then to the address if any, within India supplied by such equity shareholder to the Company for giving of notices and other documents. The detailed terms and conditions upon which the equity shareholders of the company may participate in the offer are contained in the invitation. The invitation opening date is March 07, 2005 and invitation closing date is March 11,2005.

SUBJECT: Forfeiture of shares
DETAILS: Icici Bank Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Bank had issued and allotted 8,771,300 partly paid-up equity shares of face value of Rs.10/- each issued at Rs.280/- per share on which Rs.150/- had been paid up (Rs.5/- towards share capital and Rs.145/- towards share premium) in terms of the Prospectus dated April 12, 2004. The balance amount of Rs.130/- (Rs.5/- towards share capital and Rs.125/- towards share premium) was payable on Call.  The Bank had issued a call notice dated May 31,2004 to the holders of partly paid-up equity shares for payment of call money of Rs.130/- per partly paid-up equity share (Rs.5/- towards face value and Rs.125/- towards share premium). The last date for payment of call money was June 23, 2004. The Bank had sent two Reminders dated October 15, 2004 and December 30, 2004 and also issued a Notice of Forfeiture dated January 31, 2005 advising the holders of partly paid-up shares to pay the call money together with interest thereon, on or before March 07, 2005 failing which the equity shares would be liable for forfeiture including the amount already paid thereon. Based on the response of the shareholders, the Bank would decide on the future course of action.

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Icici Bank Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BOD's of the Bank at its meeting held on December 13, 2004 approved the proposal for sponsoring an offering of American Depository shares against existing equity shares of ICICI Bank held by its equity shareholders and decided to seek the approval of Members for the same through postal ballot voting process. The Bank has appointed Mr. R Hariharan, Executive Director, S & S Business Solutions Private Limited, as the Scrutinizer for conducting the Postal Ballot process. The duly completed Postal Ballot Form should reach the Scrutinizer on or before January 24, 2005 and the report of the Scrutinizer on the postal ballot will be announced on January 28, 2005. The details of the Notice as issued by the Bank shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Outcome of AGM
DETAILS: ICICI Bank Ltd has informed the Exchange that the AGM of the members of Bank was held on September 20, 2004. All the items contained in the Notice of AGM dated July 23, 2004 have been approved by the requisite majority. Dr. Satish C. Jha, Director of the ICICI Bank did not seek re-election at the AGM held on September 20, 2004, he has ceased to be a Director of ICICI Bank effective September 20, 2004.

SUBJECT: Suspension of bonds
DETAILS: Members of the Exchange are hereby informed that the trading in the following bonds of ICICI Bank Ltd.(issued by erstwhile ICICI Ltd.) shall be suspended w.e.f. September 29, 2004 on account of final redemption as per details given below-  1. September 2001-Tax Saving Bond Sec.88 Option-I Symbol- ICICI1101 Series- N1 2. September 2001-Regular Income Bond Option-IV        Symbol- ICICI1101  Series- N8

SUBJECT: Suspension of bonds
DETAILS: Members of the Exchange are hereby informed that the trading in the December 2000-Money Multiplier Bond Option-I, Symbol-ICICI0101, Series-N6  of ICICI Bank Ltd.(issued by erstwhile ICICI Ltd.) shall be suspended w.e.f. October 07,2004 on account of final redemption.
